meanings.sent1: I am redictating that it will rain tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys redictating the outcome of sports games.
meanings.sent3: The fortune teller was redictating the future with her crystal ball.
meanings.sent4: His accurate redictating abilities made him popular among his friends.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's redictating of the experiment results was impressive.

meanings.definition: To state or declare something in advance.
meanings.sent1: The teacher is redictating the quiz questions to the students.
meanings.sent2: Politicians often redictate their promises before elections.
meanings.sent3: The magician redictated his next trick to the audience.
meanings.sent4: She redictated her decision to resign from her job.
meanings.sent5: The weatherman redictated the upcoming storm warning on TV.

meanings.definition: To communicate or convey a message or information.
meanings.sent1: He is redictating the details of the meeting to his colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The radio host redictates the news updates every hour.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was redictating the words it had learned from its owner.
meanings.sent4: The messenger redictated the urgent message to the king.
meanings.sent5: The teacher redictated the lesson to the absent student over the phone.
